sentence.text: Phenytoin\n\nIn a pharmacokinetic study with patients on methadone maintenance therapy, phenytoin administration (250 mg b.i.d.initially for 1 day followed by 300 mg QD for 3 to 4 days) resulted in an approximately 50% reduction in methadone exposure and withdrawal symptoms occurred concurrently.
Upon discontinuation of phenytoin, the incidence of withdrawal symptoms decreased and methadone exposure increased to a level comparable to that prior to phenytoin administration.
